title: Minnesota Vikings Reportedly Agree With Adam Thielen On New Deal | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Minnesota Vikings Reportedly Agree With Adam Thielen On New Deal posted by Alexander Shun - 
Alexander Shun | @alexpshun 
Digital Content Manager | KFAN.com 
The Minnesota Vikings reportedly locked up one of their top wide receivers on Wednesday, signing Adam Thielen to a contract extension. 
Thielen had a great season for Minnesota, racking up 69 catches for 967 yards and five touchdowns, including a 12 catch, 202 yard, two touchdown performance against the Green Bay Packers. Big restricted free-agent deal:Vikings and WR Adam Thielen reach agreement on three-year deal, per source.Thielen stays in Minnesota. — Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) March 15, 2017 Vikings giving WR Adam Thielen 3-year, $17M deal that could get to $27M with incentives, including $11M g'teed, per source. — Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) March 15, 2017 
Thielen was a restricted free agent with a second-round tender but, according to NFL insider Adam Schefter, the Mankato product has agreed to a three-year deal to stay in Minnesota and remain in the purple and gold. Reportedly, the contract is worth $17 million with $11 million guaranteed. 
Thielen's contract could get up to $27 million with all of the incentives, a high price to pay but one that is certainly worth it, especially for a guy who worked his way from the team's practice squad to being one of their leading receivers.
